results.title: Paul Mescal Has Been Working Things Out
results.abstract: The actor, who became a sudden sex symbol with Hulu’s “Normal People,” stars as another psychologically complex character in the A24 feature “Aftersun.”

results.title: How ‘Terrifier 2’ Slashed Its Way to Box Office Success
results.abstract: The low-budget, ultraviolent, no-stars, killer-clown horror film has been in the Top 10 since it was released theatrically earlier this month.

multimedia.caption: Lauren LaVera with Thornton in “Terrifier 2.”
Lauren LaVera with Thornton in “Terrifier 2.”
Lauren LaVera with Thornton in “Terrifier 2.”

results.title: With ‘The Good Nurse,’ a Director Takes on a Serial Killer and a System
results.abstract: Tobias Lindholm emphasizes his characters’ humanity, an approach that won over Jessica Chastain and Eddie Redmayne, stars of the Netflix true-crime thriller.

multimedia.caption: Watching David Fincher work on “Mindhunter,” Lindholm said, “gave me courage enough to pursue an American dream.”
multimedia.copyright: Devin Oktar Yalkin for The New York Times

results.title: She Knew the Cello. The Acting She Learned With Cate Blanchett.
results.abstract: Sophie Kauer was a cellist studying for a degree when a friend urged her to audition for “Tár.” She watched Michael Caine videos on acting and dived right in.

multimedia.caption: Kauer in the film. It’s not clear whether her character is naïve or cunning. “That’s the thing — you are not meant to know,” she said.
Kauer in the film. It’s not clear whether her character is naïve or cunning. “That’s the thing — you are not meant to know,” she said.
Kauer in the film. It’s not clear whether her character is naïve or cunning. “That’s the thing — you are not meant to know,” she said.

results.title: Danielle Deadwyler Is the Beating Heart of ‘Till’
results.abstract: After critically acclaimed turns in “Station Eleven” and “The Harder They Fall,” her latest role hit close to home. That’s why she was hesitant to take it on.

multimedia.caption: Danielle Deadwyler had trepidations about playing Emmett Till’s mother “because it’s a joyous endeavor, but it’s a painful one, too.”
multimedia.copyright: Simone Niamani Thompson for The New York Times

results.title: James Wan Prefers Peter Jackson’s Gory Horror Comedies
results.abstract: The director of 21st-century horror blockbusters (and “Aquaman”) on the movies, food and trading cards that get him through the Halloween season (and beyond).

results.title: The Stars of ‘The School for Good and Evil’ Share a Name. But That’s Not All.
results.abstract: Sophia Anne Caruso, 21, and Sofia Wylie, 18, are both making their feature film lead debuts in the new Netflix adaptation of Soman Chainani’s young adult fantasy series.

results.title: After #MeToo Reckoning, a Fear Hollywood Is Regressing
results.abstract: The movement led to increased diversity and representation in the entertainment industry, but now there is worry that executives have turned their attention elsewhere.

results.title: An Iranian Exile Channels Her Trauma Into Film
results.abstract: Zar Amir Ebrahimi, who had to flee Iran after an intimate tape was leaked, has been transfixed by the protests erupting there as her film “Holy Spider” is released in the U.S.

multimedia.copyright: Elliott Verdier for The New York Times
Elliott Verdier for The New York Times
Elliott Verdier for The New York Times

results.title: John Jay Osborn Jr., Author of ‘The Paper Chase,’ Dies at 77
results.abstract: His 1971 novel became a movie, with John Houseman giving an award-winning performance as the imperious Professor Kingsfield, and later a television series.

multimedia.caption: John Jay Osborn Jr. in 2016. His best-known novel, “The Paper Chase,” was the story of an earnest student trying to survive the cutthroat world of an elite law school.
John Jay Osborn Jr. in 2016. His best-known novel, “The Paper Chase,” was the story of an earnest student trying to survive the cutthroat world of an elite law school.
John Jay Osborn Jr. in 2016. His best-known novel, “The Paper Chase,” was the story of an earnest student trying to survive the cutthroat world of an elite law school.

results.title: When Henry Selick and Jordan Peele Team Up, Things Get Wild
results.abstract: The stop-motion animator and the horror writer-director collaborated on the screenplay for Selick’s latest darkly comic fable “Wendell & Wild.”

multimedia.caption: Kat (voiced by Lyric Ross), center, is one of the lead characters of the animated film “Wendell & Wild,” directed by Henry Selick and written by Selick and Jordan Peele.

results.title: ‘Holy Spider’ Review: Brutality Tale
results.abstract: Like many a serial-killer drama, this movie about a real-life Iranian murderer who targeted prostitutes is a grisly thriller parading as a morality tale.

results.title: ‘Wendell and Wild’ Review: Not Wild Enough
results.abstract: This devilish stop-motion horror comedy from Henry Selick and Jordan Peele can’t quite breathe life into its narrative.

results.title: ‘The Runner’ Is a Gem of the Iranian New Wave
results.abstract: Amir Naderi’s scrappy, intimate film, which follows an 11-year-old garbage scavenger in Iran, is getting a second viewing at Film Forum in Manhattan.

results.title: ‘New York, New York,’ a Film-Inspired Homage, Plans Broadway Bow
results.abstract: The new musical, based on the 1977 Martin Scorsese film, features songs by John Kander and Fred Ebb and is directed by Susan Stroman.

results.title: James Cameron and the Cast of ‘Avatar: The Way of Water’ Hold Their Breath
results.abstract: The original was the biggest hit ever, but the sequel still took a long time to come together. How will it resonate in a different era of moviegoing?

multimedia.caption: The “Avatar” sequel arrives 13 years after the original, and now Sam Worthington’s Jake Sully, at right, is the father of a brood.
The “Avatar” sequel arrives 13 years after the original, and now Sam Worthington’s Jake Sully, at right, is the father of a brood.

results.title: ‘The African Desperate’ Expands the Movies’ Narrow View of the Art World
results.abstract: Most films set adjacent to studios and galleries lampoon unfathomable pretension, but Martine Syms takes a more nuanced approached in her look at art schools.

multimedia.caption: Diamond Stingily as a Master of Fine Arts student in “The African Desperate,” directed by Martine Syms. Both the star and director are artists.
Diamond Stingily as a Master of Fine Arts student in “The African Desperate,” directed by Martine Syms. Both the star and director are artists.

results.title: How George Clooney and Julia Roberts Quietly Became the Tracy-Hepburn of Our Time
results.abstract: “Ticket to Paradise” and other team-ups take advantage of their onscreen glamour and stellar chemistry and their offscreen affection for one another.

multimedia.caption: They each bring movie-star qualities in addition to their onscreen chemistry.
They each bring movie-star qualities in addition to their onscreen chemistry.
They each bring movie-star qualities in addition to their onscreen chemistry.

results.title: ‘Everything Everywhere,’ All Through Awards Season?
results.abstract: At a screening filled with Oscar voters, Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan and the directors marveled at the way their quirky film has struck a chord.

results.title: ‘Glengarry Glen Ross’ and ‘Reservoir Dogs’ at 30: Men Talking
results.abstract: These dramas, both known for distinctive (and salty) dialogue, didn’t make much of a box office impression in 1992. But their influence is still being felt.

results.title: Guillermo del Toro Opens His ‘Cabinet of Curiosities’
results.abstract: For the first season of his horror anthology for Netflix, the filmmaker handpicked eight directors to tell a series of strange and macabre tales.
des_facet: Guillermo del Toro's Cabinet of Curiosities (TV Program)

multimedia.caption: Guillermo del Toro in one of the introductions to an episode of “Cabinet of Curiosities.” He created the series with the goal of highlighting stories, storytellers and filmmakers he loves.

results.title: Kevin Spacey Is Cleared of Anthony Rapp’s Battery Claim
results.abstract: A jury found Mr. Spacey not liable in a civil trial. Mr. Rapp, an original cast member in “Rent,” had filed a lawsuit accusing Mr. Spacey of making a sexual advance when Mr. Rapp was 14.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Nate Schweber

multimedia.caption: After less than an hour and a half of deliberation on Thursday, a jury in the U.S. District Court in Manhattan decided in favor of Kevin Spacey.
After less than an hour and a half of deliberation on Thursday, a jury in the U.S. District Court in Manhattan decided in favor of Kevin Spacey.
After less than an hour and a half of deliberation on Thursday, a jury in the U.S. District Court in Manhattan decided in favor of Kevin Spacey.

results.title: ‘Face’ Review: Close Encounters
results.abstract: Commissioned by the Louvre, the film brings together two of cinema’s unforgettable faces, Lee Kang-sheng and Jean-Pierre Léaud.

multimedia.caption: Lee Kang-sheng and Laetitia Casta in “Face,” directed by Tsai Ming-liang.

results.title: ‘Voodoo Macbeth’ Review: A Tiresome Curse
results.abstract: A historical look back at Orson Welles’s production of “Macbeth” with an all-Black cast in Harlem in the 1930s.

results.title: ‘Descendant’ Review: The Fates of a Ship and Its Captives
results.abstract: This documentary recounts the salvaging of the Clotilda, the last known ship to bring enslaved Africans to America, and tracks down their progeny.

multimedia.caption: Veda Tunstall, one of the interview subjects in Margaret Brown’s documentary “Descendant.”
Veda Tunstall, one of the interview subjects in Margaret Brown’s documentary “Descendant.”

results.title: Animal Lovers, Rejoice: The NY Cat and Dog Film Festivals Return
results.abstract: The programs feature many surprises, including a cat that plays Wordle and a lone man’s odyssey to feed Turkish strays.

multimedia.caption: “Kimo & Jazz,” a coming-out story, is part of the NY Dog Film Festival.
“Kimo & Jazz,” a coming-out story, is part of the NY Dog Film Festival.

results.title: ‘My Policeman’ Review: Two Love Affairs, Equally Tragic
results.abstract: A schoolteacher, her police officer husband and his lover deny each other romantic satisfaction in this dismal melodrama.

results.title: ‘All That Breathes’ Review: Hope Is the Thing With Feathers
results.abstract: Shaunak Sen’s poetic documentary chronicles the efforts of three New Delhi men to help the city’s birds of prey.
